subject: p18615099
History: Failure to thrive and frequent falls. Question pneumonia or rib fracture.
Findings: The patient is status post coronary artery bypass graft surgery. A dual-lead pacemaker/ICD device appears unchanged. The mediastinal and hilar contours appear unchanged. The heart appears mildly enlarged. A widespread interstitial abnormality suggests mild vascular congestion. Although there is increased relative opacification of the left mid lung compared to the right, an asymmetric pattern of pulmonary edema has been seen on prior radiographs such as .
Impression: Findings most suggestive of mild-to-moderate interstitial pulmonary edema.
